Class GameController

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class GameController
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    The class GameController is the controller of the game. It implements the interface ActionListener to be called back when the player makes a move. It computes the next step of the game, and then updates model and view.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GameController(int size)
      Constructor used for initializing the controller.

      Callback used when the user clicks a button or one of the dots.
      void redo()
      reverts the game to a future state if no actions have been performed.

      resets the game
      void undo()
      reverts the game to a previous state

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameController

        public GameController(int size)
        Constructor used for initializing the controller. It creates the game's view and the game's model instances
        Parameters:
        size - the size of the board on which the game will be played
